titles: The strange, vvonderfull, and bloudy battell betweene frogs and mise the occasion of their falling out: their preparation, munition, and resolution for the warres: the seuerall combats of euery person of worth; with many other memorable accidents. Interlaced with diuers pithy and morall sentences, no lesse pleasant to be read, then profitable to be obserued. Couertly decyphering the estate of these times. Paraphrastically done into English heroycall verse by W.F. C.C.C.
Battle of the frogs and mice. English.
author: Fowldes, William.
Homer, attributed name.
publisher: Printed by S. S[tafford] for Iohn Bayly: and are to be sold at his shop in Chauncery lane, neere to the office of the sixe Clarkes,
notes: Attributed in antiquity to Homer, but probably of a much later date.
Running title reads: The battell betweene frogs and mise.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
